author: Dylan
text: So I was emailed stating my account had been frozen and banned due to fraudulent activity patterns on my account. I reached out via email and Lennox stated the same thing. I asked for any sort of proof of this “fraudulent activity” and didn’t hear back for 4 days. When I finally send a follow up email and write my first review on TrustPilot, I recieved a response from Nico stating that my account has been frozen, not banned, for “impersonating another Grailed user/ having the name SaruGeneral”. I’ve mentioned to every buyer that asks if I’m the same SaruGeneral from Instagram, that I’m not the same person. SaruGeneral reached out to Grailed about me having his name. I messaged saru general about this and he claims he doesn’t use Grailed. I reached out via Instagram to Grailed to let them know and for a quick response. They told me all I would have to do is change my name and avatar and my account would be back to normal. So I reached out via email, and after three days, Lennox responds stating “As mentioned, you’re account can not be reinstated.” So why do I have three Grailed employees telling me different things? Two are saying it’s due to the name and my account should be okay and sorry for the confusion. While Lennox is still claiming my account to be banned for Fraudulent activity.
title: why isn’t everyone on the same page??

author: Miguel Sierra
text:
So I contacted the support team and they replied in this manner:

"Unfortunately we can refund the transaction from our end due to the seller's account being frozen before the 5 day guideline. As the seller is now unable to message or add tracking via Grailed, we can not confirm the seller being unresponsive or the shipment of the item within the 5 day period."
So because THEY froze his account for suspicious activity, I am now unable to get a refund through Grailed since it was frozen before the 5 day guideline. Luckily, I signed into my Paypal account before making the purchase and I am able to file a report through Paypal, but I will certainly not be making any more purchases or sales through Grailed, as they are telling me they cannot do anything to help even though they're still holding the money (I believe.)
